text: The recent clarification on CSR expenditure for COVID-19 related activities is a commendable and timely move. Thank you, MCA.
The MCA21 V3 portal is consistently failing during peak filing hours. Uploading AOC-4 and MGT-7 has become a nightmare. System stability must be the top priority.
Regarding the new rules on auditor rotation, could the Ministry please clarify its applicability to a company that has ceased to meet the threshold criteria?
The requirement to file Form BEN-2 for every minor change in beneficial ownership is creating an enormous compliance burden. A consolidated annual return should be considered.
Appreciate the proactive measure of extending the due date for AGM. This provides much-needed relief to companies struggling with post-pandemic challenges.
The DIR-3 KYC process is still plagued with OTP issues, especially for foreign directors. An alternative verification mechanism is urgently needed.
The proposal to decriminalize certain offenses under the Companies Act is a step in the right direction. It will improve the ease of doing business.
The discrepancy between the master data on the portal and the pre-filled data in forms is causing numerous resubmissions. Please fix the data synchronization.
The introduction of SPICe+ was a game-changer for incorporation. However, the process for post-incorporation changes remains cumbersome.
Why was the Straight Through Process (STP) for Form CHG-1 removed? It's now taking weeks for charge satisfaction to be registered.
The new valuation rules for unquoted shares are ambiguous. We need detailed guidelines or FAQs to ensure uniform application.
The move to mandate web-based KYC for directors is good, but the servers seem unable to handle the load. Many professionals are facing login timeouts.
Could the MCA clarify if an independent director can be on the audit committee of more than the prescribed number of companies if one is a Section 8 company?
The frequent changes in e-forms without adequate notice disrupt workflow. A minimum transition period of 30 days should be mandatory.
Kudos to the Ministry for the comprehensive FAQ on Corporate Social Responsibility. It has resolved many practical queries.
The penalty regime for non-compliance with SBO reporting is draconian. There should be a distinction between wilful default and procedural lapses.
The online inspection of public documents is a fantastic transparency initiative. However, many older documents are poorly scanned and illegible.
We request an extension for filing Form DPT-3 due to the ongoing technical issues with the V3 portal's payment gateway.
The concept of Small Company needs to be revised. The current turnover and capital thresholds are too low and exclude many MSMEs from availing benefits.
The procedure for striking off a company under STK-2 is much improved, but the processing time by the ROC is still very long.
The mandatory requirement for a registered valuer's report for a rights issue under Section 62 feels like an over-regulation for private companies.
The article on Corporate Governance is insightful, but it fails to address the challenges faced by startups in constituting a formal board.
Why is there no option to revise Form AOC-4 XBRL once filed, even for clerical errors? This leads to unnecessary adjudications.
The new LLP settlement scheme is a welcome relief. It will allow many defunct LLPs to regularize their filings and achieve a clean slate.
The interpretation of 'related party' continues to be a grey area. A master circular consolidating all amendments and clarifications would be invaluable.
The process for name reservation (RUN) is fast, but the reasons for rejection are often vague. More specific feedback from the CRC is needed.
Excellent move to integrate the PAN/TAN application with the incorporation form. It has streamlined the entire setup process for new businesses.
The lack of a proper helpdesk for V3 portal issues is a major concern. The ticket resolution time is unacceptably long.
Is interest on a loan from a director's relative considered an exempt deposit under the rules? The language is ambiguous.
The requirement of a physical registered office is outdated in the age of remote work. The MCA should consider allowing virtual office addresses for certain types of companies.
The format for the Board Report has become a copy-paste exercise. It needs to be revamped to provide more meaningful insights to shareholders.
The proposal to introduce a Central Scrutiny Cell is a positive step towards ensuring the accuracy of filings and reducing ROC workload.
Trying to download Form MGT-7A results in a 'File not found' error. This has been happening for three days. Please resolve this technical glitch.
The article on Nidhi companies is very informative, but it does not cover the practical difficulties in complying with the Net Owned Funds ratio.
We urge the MCA to issue a moratorium on late fees for all forms until the V3 portal is fully stabilized and functional.
The limits for managerial remuneration under Schedule V need to be inflation-indexed. The current limits are too restrictive for large companies.
Thank you for simplifying the compliance for One Person Companies (OPCs). This will encourage more entrepreneurs to adopt this structure.
The constant changes in the XBRL taxonomy make annual filing a very challenging task. The taxonomy should be fixed for a block of at least 3 years.
The requirement of obtaining a No Objection Certificate from creditors for a reduction of share capital is a practical bottleneck. A deemed approval process should be considered.
The digital signature (DSC) registration process on the V3 portal is not user-friendly. It often fails to recognize valid DSCs.
A clear roadmap for the remaining forms to be migrated to V3 would help professionals plan their work and advise clients accordingly.
The rule requiring the preservation of books of account for eight years is fine, but the mandate to keep them at the registered office is impractical for multi-location companies.
The initiative to link director's DIN with their DigiLocker is a great step towards data integrity and security.
The adjudication process for non-compliance is becoming increasingly aggressive. A more consultative and reformative approach should be adopted.
Could the Ministry provide a list of common errors that lead to the resubmission of SPICe+ forms? This would help reduce rejection rates.
The definition of a 'start-up' for Companies Act exemptions should be aligned with the DPIIT definition to avoid confusion.
This article fails to mention the challenges in getting refunds for erroneously paid stamp duty during incorporation. The process is opaque and slow.
The Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF) rules for transferring shares are complex. A simplified, one-window clearance mechanism is needed.
The mandatory filing of Form PAS-3 for allotment of securities is clear, but what is the procedure if the form is filed with a delay of over a year?
A consolidated Master Circular on Private Placements is long overdue. Professionals have to refer to multiple circulars and amendments.
The pre-scrutiny button on the V3 portal often gives misleading errors. What passes pre-scrutiny fails at the final upload stage.
The move towards AI-based scrutiny of financial statements is futuristic, but the algorithm needs to be trained to understand industry-specific nuances.
The provision for conducting EGMs via video conferencing should be made a permanent feature, not just a temporary COVID-19 relief measure.
The requirement for every company to have a website is a good idea, but it should be exempted for small and dormant companies to reduce their cost of compliance.
The process for Condonation of Delay (Form CG-1) is time-consuming. Can this be delegated to the Regional Director for faster disposal?
This is a very well-written article explaining the nuances of Section 186. It clarifies many long-standing doubts.
The V3 portal's user interface is not intuitive. It requires multiple clicks to perform simple tasks that were straightforward on the V2 portal.
When will the MCA introduce a form for registering a change in the partners of an LLP's designated partner which is a body corporate?
The fee for filing some forms is disproportionately high compared to the nature of the event being reported. A review of the fee structure is warranted.
The requirement of Secretarial Audit for larger companies is a great governance check. Its scope should be expanded to include compliance with other economic laws.
Please provide clarity on whether CSR funds can be used for sponsoring academic research in a field related to the company's business.
The system of 'Pay Later' for MCA forms is problematic. Often, the payment link is not generated, causing filings to be delayed and late fees to be levied.
The proposal to have a single, unified annual return for all regulators (MCA, SEBI, RBI) would be a landmark reform. Please expedite this.
The processing of name change applications is taking more than a month. This delays rebranding activities and business operations.
The maximum number of directorships needs to be reconsidered. The current limit of 20 is too high and impacts the quality of oversight.
We need a mechanism to surrender a DIN that has been allotted but never used, without having to file DIR-3 KYC for it.
The article on mergers and amalgamations is too academic. It should have included a practical checklist for professionals.
Why are ROCs in different states interpreting the same provision of the Companies Act differently? There needs to be a central mechanism for standardization.
The V3 login system using email ID is a security risk. The previous system of using a User ID was more secure and distinct.
The limit of 2 layers of subsidiaries is a good measure to curb money laundering, but it creates practical issues for large, legitimate corporate structures.
The idea of a 'dormant company' is excellent on paper, but the process of getting that status is more cumbersome than the annual compliance itself.
A very timely article on the duties of an independent director. Must read for all board members.
The public search of charges on the MCA portal is a critical due diligence tool. Thank you for making this information freely accessible.
The process for shifting a registered office from one state to another is incredibly long and involves too many authorities. It needs to be streamlined.
The automatic deactivation of DIN for non-filing of DIR-3 KYC is a harsh measure. A 30-day grace period with a warning should be provided.
The concept of an 'officer in default' is often applied too broadly by ROCs, penalizing individuals who have no direct involvement in the non-compliance.
The new webforms are not compatible with older browser versions, which is a problem for many small professional firms. This should be addressed.
The requirement for a professional's certification on a form should be sufficient. Why is the ROC still asking for underlying documents for STP forms?
Could the MCA release annual statistics on company formations, strike-offs, and popular sectors? This data would be very useful for economic analysis.
The fee structure for LLP forms is much lower than for company forms, which is a great incentive for small businesses to choose the LLP structure.
The article on the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) is well-summarized but should have highlighted the low recovery rates, which is a major concern.
The response time from the ROC for queries raised via email is extremely poor. A more efficient communication channel is needed.
The mandate to have at least one woman director is a progressive step for gender diversity on boards.
The VFO (View Public Documents) service is often down during weekends. It should be available 24/7 as advertised.
Harmonizing the definition of a financial year across all statutes (Companies Act, Income Tax Act) would simplify compliance immensely.
The new Certificate of Incorporation includes PAN and TAN, which is highly efficient. A great example of inter-departmental coordination.
The compliance calendar on the MCA website is a very useful tool, but it is not updated regularly with extended due dates.
The process of getting a director's DSC re-registered after it has been updated is a major pain point on the new portal.
The provisions related to entrenchment in the Articles of Association are a powerful tool for protecting minority shareholders, but they are rarely used due to lack of awareness.
Why is it mandatory to provide a mobile number and email ID of every director and subscriber? This raises privacy concerns.
The e-adjudication mechanism is a welcome change. It will bring transparency and speed to the penalty process.
Filing Form GNL-2 for compounding of offenses is straightforward, but the hearing process is often delayed without any reason.
The recent circular allowing companies to hold AGMs through VC until September is helpful, but an extension until December would be more practical.
The search functionality on the MCA website is poor. It is very difficult to find old circulars or notifications.
The article's suggestion for a 'Business Responsibility and Sustainability Report' is good, but it will be a huge cost for small listed entities.
There is no clarity on the applicability of Secretarial Standards to Section 8 companies. An official circular is needed to settle this issue.
The size limit for attachments on the V3 portal is too small. For resolutions and agreements, it often requires compressing the file to a poor quality.
The Companies Fresh Start Scheme was a huge success. We request the Ministry to consider launching a similar scheme for LLPs.
The transition from physical share certificates to mandatory dematerialization for private companies is a significant challenge. The infrastructure and awareness are still lacking.
Excellent and balanced analysis of the proposed amendments to the LLP Act. The focus on easing business for LLPs is clearly visible.
